channel.title: Pimples?
channel.description:
Whats the best way to get rid of them. We all had them unless your like 9.. Then IDK :)
Post your comments

item.title: Pimples?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Clean and Clear Advantage Acne Spot Treatment, simple cheep thing I have been using since I was like 15, you don’t need to use it everyday, just make sure you get a washcloth in your shower and scrub (not too hardly) till you see that no more skin flakes are peeling off. Then heres a big thing, never pop a pimple, acne marks can last up to a year or two which is horrible to live with. Just put the stuff on I mentioned and the pimple will be gone after one or two applications. Don’t pay a ton of money for a skin cream or something, simple things like deep washing your face in the shower (takes 2 mins literly) and putting this stuff on right when you feel one coming, or when you see one on your skin will get rid of them.

Walgreens

Clean & Clear Advantage Advantage Acne Spot Treatment

Clean & Clear Advantage Advantage Acne Spot Treatment at Walgreens. Get free shipping at $35 and view promotions and reviews for Clean & Clear Advantage Advantage Acne Spot Treatment

Link above it’s like $7 USD, I get it at Walgreens for like $4. Personally I think the stuffs amazing, never dried out my skin and it actually fucken works, not like proactive that is basically super soap and the main reason it works is because it says you wash your face before. >> But yeah, it’s normal for light burning while using it, that’s it killing the bacteria on your skin.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples?
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:7, topic:415420”]Accutane. I’m currently on it.[/quote]was amazing back in the day when I was on it… some very very mild pimples came back, on my nose and forehead… which i got acne laser therapy (6 treatments - 750$) to treat them permanently ( only use this option if you have the money to spend) i was every insecure about my skin, so i went to great lengths… including proactiv, which… works… to a degree… very drying on my face, but did clear it pretty well.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

If not suggested also you could try rubbing alcohol. Ive used it a couple times and it seemed to work decently. The best thing Ive used so far is Clearasil pore cleansing pads. They work well and should be able to get rid of your pimple problem in no time.

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:43, topic:415420”]I have tried proactive and nuetrogena (SP?), and neither have worked…however I wasn’t using them every day and night like I was supposed to, so I don’t have accurate information there.

I’ve noticed washing your face with a warm wet washcloth morning and night might clear acne up a little. The whole point is to avoid drying and irritating your skin, keep it moisturized (use a moisturizer if you have to). Don’t use acne products with oil in them and never try to dry out your face, it will just cause your pores to produce more oil.[/quote]
Lol just use that lotion that we all know you have, it has other purposes too you know!

Read full topic

item.title: Pimples?
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I have tried proactive and nuetrogena (SP?), and neither have worked…however I wasn’t using them every day and night like I was supposed to, so I don’t have accurate information there.

I’ve noticed washing your face with a warm wet washcloth morning and night might clear acne up a little. The whole point is to avoid drying and irritating your skin, keep it moisturized (use a moisturizer if you have to). Don’t use acne products with oil in them and never try to dry out your face, it will just cause your pores to produce more oil.

Read full topic
